gameDescription: In the green corridors of Africa, Asia, and Vietnam, the Red and Blue teams deploy intelligent airships on a mission to protect the most trafficked mammal worldwide - the Pangolin. These airships are tasked with transporting rescued pangolins and building materials for new enclosures. Each strategic decision not only determines the mission's success but also has a profound impact on the environment and the future of pangolin conservation.

blueTeam.name: Phoenix Floats
blueTeam.description: Specializing in quick and safe animal transportation and logistics.

redTeam.name: Skyward Saviors
redTeam.description: Experts in ecology preservation and end-to-end mission effectiveness.

turns.scenario: Both airships need to collect pangolins from high-risk poaching areas. However, time is of the essence as poachers are closing in.

options.A: A rapid and stealthy mission to collect as many pangolins as possible.
options.B: A slower, discreet mission to collect pangolins without alerting poachers, but potentially leaving some pangolins behind.

AA.narrative: Both teams make a dash for the rescue. They manage to save many pangolins but alert the poachers, risking future rescue attempts.

AB.narrative: One team speeds whilst the other takes it slow. The rapid team saves more pangolins but has now put the slower team at risk of being discovered.

BA.narrative: One team conducts a slow rescue, leaving some pangolins, while the other rescues numerous pangolins but alerts poachers. Overall, more pangolins are rescued, but future missions are jeopardized.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for a cautious and slower mission, successfully rescuing a number of pangolins without alerting the poachers, setting the pace for future rescue missions.

turns.scenario: While transporting rescued pangolins, both airships receive urgent orders to procure enclosure building materials to continue sanctuary development in Vietnam.

options.A: Divert to collect the materials, risking the wellbeing of the stressed pangolins onboard.
options.B: Continue the course to the sanctuary, possibly delaying construction.

AA.narrative: Both teams divert and procure supplies, causing distress to the pangolins onboard. However, they ensure that sanctuary construction remains on schedule.

AB.narrative: One airship diverts for supplies while the other proceeds. The diversion team mildly distresses their pangolins but keeps construction on track, while the other prioritizes pangolin well-being.

BA.narrative: One team proceeds to the sanctuary while the other diverts. Pangolins are well-cared for, but delays in construction occur. It's a balance of immediate needs versus future needs.

BB.narrative: Both teams prioritize the health and safety of their pangolins and continue to the sanctuary. They've demonstrated a great commitment to animal welfare, but the enclosure's completion is delayed.

turns.scenario: The airships approach Vietnam amidst heavy monsoon activity, challenging navigation and potential distress for the pangolins. They must determine their course.

options.A: Brave the storm directly for a quicker arrival, endangering the airships.
options.B: Detour around the storm, adding time to the journey but providing a smoother ride for the rescued pangolins.

AA.narrative: Both teams choose to brave the storm for a swift delivery of the pangolins and building supplies. They run risks but succeed in making a timely arrival.

AB.narrative: One airship braves the storm, while the other circumvents it. By doing so, they balance risk and ensure all pangolins arrive safely albeit at different times.

BA.narrative: One team takes a longer route to protect their cargo, while the other team endures the storm and risks potential damage to the airship. Their choices embody the complex nature of such rescue missions.

BB.narrative: Both teams choose the detour, prioritizing the wellbeing of the pangolins. The journey is longer, but all creatures arrive at the sanctuary in good health.
